sentences.english: Snowflakes were swirling in the air.
Being evil to copy is a , not many your family Wu is then blank blood rain to float to spread.
sentences.chinese: 魔影一出，不多时吴府上空便血雨飘飘洒洒。

sentences.english: To the sweet rain of May.
The beautiful snow is suffusing from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 迷漫的雪花从天而降，飘洒飞扬。

sentences.english: My hands reached out, catching nothing but a rain drop, on a leaf that had withered.
sentences.chinese: 伸手所触兮，惟一叶飘零一滴飘洒。

sentences.english: I am the gentle showers of rain, on westfall's fields of golden grain.
sentences.chinese: 我是温柔和煦的雨，飘洒在金光闪烁的田野。

sentences.english: The depth of the landscape is delineated by mysterious flairs of white, the powdery blue snow embankment.
sentences.chinese: 诡秘的白色与飘洒的蓝色雪粉建构了景深。

definition: to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
lit. to fill the whole sky/everywhere/as far as the eye can see
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
